summary: October is the tenth month of the year, with 31 days. It got its name from Latin and Greek words meaning "eight" because it was originally the eighth month in ancient Roman calendars. October is associated with autumn in the Northern Hemisphere and spring in the Southern Hemisphere. In ancient Rome, several important festivals took place during this month. The Anglo-Saxons called it "Winterfylleth," believing winter began with the full moon in October.
title: October
